parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided text.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>True. The post explicitly mentions Ciprian Serban, a candidate for the Chamber of Deputies, and his affiliation with the PSD party.  This directly refers to a parliamentary candidate, fulfilling Article 36 (7) - a.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and the content is not a private communication. It aims to reach a wide audience, fulfilling Article 36 (7) - c.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>True. The post discusses Ciprian Serban's political career and influence within the PSD, highlighting his recent appointment as group leader. This information is presented in a way that could positively influence voters' perception of Serban and, consequently, their voting decision. This fulfills Article 36 (7) - c. The objective is to improve the image of the candidate and implicitly encourage voting for him.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>False. While the post presents information about Ciprian Serban, it lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected from journalistic reporting. The language used is biased and presents a largely positive portrayal of Serban, suggesting an intention to influence voters rather than simply inform them.  It does not adhere to journalistic standards.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post is not a personal opinion; it's a structured narrative that aims to present Ciprian Serban in a positive light, which is clearly intended to influence voters' choices.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>509034284929292</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, paid for by Moldova Invest, focuses on Ciprian Serban, a PSD candidate for the Chamber of Deputies.  The post highlights Serban's political achievements and influence within the PSD, presenting him in a positive light.  This is done through a structured narrative, not a personal opinion. The post's objective is clearly to influence voters' perception of Serban and encourage them to vote for him.  The targeting of Neamț County, where Serban is running, further strengthens this conclusion.  While the post doesn't explicitly call for votes, its content is undeniably electoral propaganda.  The lack of journalistic objectivity and the clear intention to influence voters make it a violation.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate> <name>CIPRIAN CONSTANTIN SERBAN</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>PSD</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Moldova Invest, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postări pe Facebook (ID 509034284929292) care promovează pe Ciprian Constantin Serban, candidat PSD la Camera Deputaților, prezentându-l într-o lumină pozitivă și evidențiind influența sa politică, fără a respecta standardele jurnalismului obiectiv.  Efectul electoral al acestei postări este clar, având ca obiectiv influențarea votului în favoarea lui Serban.  Conținutul postării, structurat ca o narațiune favorabilă candidatului, constituie propagandă electorală, încălcând prevederile legale.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
